TopicTitle: ALL 32-bit users: your KSP v1.0.4 GameData folder excluding Squad folder

Articles.Content:
Please read the instructions.

- this does not apply to 64-bit players

- this is for v.1.0.4 Kerbal Space Program only

- exclude the volume of Squad folder

Here's a poll, mainly for the people who use mods. It starts logarithmically and proceeds linearly. I tried to cover the mod user classes to have roughly the same density as my hypothetical distribution is. I doubt there are many people who have enormous amount of mods.

The poll will end in ten days because I want the sample to be as less smeared over time as possible and still to have enough people voting.

Edited August 28, 2015 by lajoswinkler

395 MB since I no longer use KSPI. It runs very stable though.

Edit: Apparently 414 925 656 B since Windows doesn't know the difference between MB and MiB.

Edited August 26, 2015 by theend3r
What will you do with this information?

I'm running about 51mb in my current save. Mostly code mods that provide information, plus things like PlanetShine. It's basically a stock install + KAS/KIS (which needed to be stock decades ago) + procedural fairings (they aren't as broken as stock ones :/ ) parts-wise.

My only other active save at this time is my BTSM one, which is approximately the same size.

What will you do with this information?

I will find all people from one poll class and put them in the fetus room.

Which class? That's a secret.

I picked less than 200, but it's right at 199MB. At least for my stock-ish install. For RSS/RO? That's closer to 1.7GBs. Both of those on PC, and both run reasonably smooth. They still crash every 119 minutes, but other than that no major issues. On OS-X my GameData folder (outside of Squad) is about 200KBs, consisting of only my flags. Even at 1/4 image resolution and low graphics settings that's still unplayable, and crashes every 20 minutes or so. But I'm only putting info for my main Windows stock-ish install into your poll since they other two are edge cases.

What will you do with this information?
I will find all people from one poll class and put them in the fetus room.

Which class? That's a secret.

And here I was hoping you were just going to sell it to belligerent space aliens instead....
Realism Overhaul takes like 1 or 2 Gbs of data. So not a lost of room left.
1.39 GB (1430 MB) for my RSS game, 1.36 GB for my main ~15-mods game. A bit high, isn't it ?

Mine is about 490 MB, but only because I can't add any more mods due to RAM limits.

(I refuse to run under opengl and its visual degradation, and DX11 mode causes my FPS to drop to single digits while building or flying a craft with more than 5 parts.)

A 64bit client can't come soon enough...
Installed Realism Overhaul literally yesterday, so 475 MB. Haven't hit the limit yet, though the game laaaaags, CPU wise.
1GB, but almost 200MB of that is ATM cache.

116 MB.

Huh, expected more for 40 mods...
The normal distribution curve is slowly appearing, although I haven't anticipated so many realism overhaul users. Oh well, they'll join the fetus room, too.
606 MB. That probably why the game crashes so often.

292 here.

Please provide more information on the Fetus/Foetus Room. I strongly suggest it be made into a mod/part for in-game use as a single Kerbal Hitchhiker pod. IVA must be provided as well - goes without saying. This request is based on my reading of the definition from urban dictionary. Please begin visualising now...
Once it was at 1.9 GB. I crashed the game more than I crashed my rockets.
843MB. New Horizon planet pack and VEN's take up a lot of room.

Is KSP going completely 64 bit.(I'm hoping for this.) it would make it alot easier on steam. Wouldn't have to find that stupid command and check which version I'm running and worry sometimes if I saved it correctly when I get paranoid!
49,1 Mb. I don't use part- or texture-heavy mods.

Edit: Apparently 414 925 656 B since Windows doesn't know the difference between MB and MiB.

Neither did I! Thank you for fueling my Google curiosity.

I think mine is around 100MB (or MiB, since I'm rounding anyway), but I'll have to check when I get home, so I won't respond right now.

Yup, right in that 100MB ballpark as I thought.

But then I work to keep it that way, not installing EVE only because of memory. And I don't like many custom parts...
6,000 (kilobytes)

1.76 GB with Active Texture Management. 1.1 GB without it.

I can't wait to live the 64-bit dream again, and without the problems associated with OpenGL.

My KSP folders minus Squad

0.25 - 1,48 GB

0.90 - 2,83 GB

1.0.2 - 873 MB

1.0.3 - 865 MB

0.90 was my favorite playthrough so far
